item.title: The Booming Business of Kidnapping in Nigeria
item.description: Islamic insurgents and other heavily armed groups have increasingly turned to kidnapping to get money. They abduct individuals, families and even large groups and then demand to be paid to let them go. We hear the story of one family, whose life has been turned upside down by a kidnapping.

item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers fired Ippei Mizuhara last week. Three months earlier, the team called Mizuhara "Shohei's best buddy."

item.title: What to know about the Moscow concert attack and what's next in the case
item.description: Russia is still reeling from Friday's attack. Authorities have confirmed at least 137 dead. Suspects, some showing signs of torture, have been charged. Here are other key developments.

item.title: Hurry up and wait: Servers speed-walk through Paris, reviving a century-old race
item.description: Some 200 servers speed-walked through Paris balancing trays of beverages and croissants on Sunday. Paris hasn't held a waiters race since 2011, but brought it back ahead of the Olympics.

item.title: Israel cancels high-level talks in Washington after cease-fire vote clears the U.N.
item.description: The Security Council voted 14-0 in favor of a resolution demanding a cease-fire through the end of Ramadan in two weeks. The United States abstained from the vote, allowing the measure to pass.

item.title: What's at stake in the Supreme Court mifepristone case
item.description: The case could affect not just abortion access but oversight of the drug industry and the authority of federal agencies. The court hears arguments Tuesday.

item.title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down, part of a shakeup after 737 Max problems
item.description: After several difficult months, Boeing announced its embattled chief executive will step down at the end of this year. In January, an Alaska Airlines 737 Max had an in-flight door plug blowout.

item.title: Israeli defense chief visits U.S.; 4 men charged in Moscow concert hall attack
item.description: Israel's defense minister meets with U.S. officials today amid rising tensions between the allies. Russia charged four men with terrorism in connection to the Moscow attack that killed more than 130.
